data.title: Maurice Christian
data.text:
An artisan’s journey…..

Born in Chicago, Illinois,

Maurice has traveled throughout the United States, Canada, and Japan

His many natural talents include- drawing, acting, dancing, singing, and writing songs for which he creates both, lyrics and melody

Has performed in many venues – from Jensen Elementary School as a third grader singing in front of school classes to guest starring on the Midnight Special Show, hosted by Wolfman Jack, Dick Clark’s American Bandstand, the Wolfman Jack TV Series, Knott’s Berry Farm Halloween Haunt (Goodtime Theatre), The Sherry Lewis Show, AM America (Chicago), The Allen Hamel Show, and so many more….as one of The Puppets while touring with Wolfman Jack

Sign to two Record Labels- MCA Records (Dream Express) and Brookhill Records (solo)

Performed with many well -known artist- such as Ray Charles, Harold Melvin & The Blue Notes, Stylistics, Ohio Players, Kool & The Gang, The Staple Singers, Little Richard, Gladys Knight & The Pips, The Miracles, The Fifth Dimension, Little Anthony & The Imperials, Kenny Rogers, Jose Feliciano, William “Smokey” Robinson, Lou Rawls and many more….

Super Star Fantasy Entertainment – Impersonating Michael Jackson and James Brown

Formed and headed his own group- Just Us …and more!

Lead singer for- Elmer Armstrong’s Legendary “The Platters” group

Official Member for- Gary Steven’s/Delfonics

In addition to his inherent artistic, song-writing, singing, producer talents, Maurice is a longtime continued supporter for St. Jude Hospital Children’s Ward in sharing an engaging sense of humor and a magnetic charisma- a combination of qualities that ensures a dynamic and captivating uplift to the helpful recovery of the children.
